akn:content.akn:p: (a) In carrying out section 2911(a) of this title, the Secretary of Defense shall ensure the types, availability, and use of operational energy promote the readiness of the armed forces for their military missions in contested logistics environments.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Functions of the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Energy, Installations, and Environment.—

akn:content.akn:p: (c) The Assistant Secretary of Defense for Energy, Installations, and Environment, in consultation with the heads of the appropriate Department of Defense components and in coordination with the working group under subsection (d), shall—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Access to Initiative Results and Records.—

akn:content.akn:p: (h) In this section, the term “contested logistics environment” means an environment in which the armed forces engage in conflict with an adversary that presents challenges in all domains and directly targets logistics operations, facilities, and activities in the United States, abroad, or in transit from one location to the other.
